---
layout:         post-mbed-org
title:          "mbed Application Board on sale!"
date:           2013-03-13T11:17:40.000Z
author:         Chris Styles
tags:           
originalUrl:    https://developer.mbed.org/blog/entry/mbed-Application-Board-on-sale/
---

<p>
  The <a href="/cookbook/mbed-application-board">mbed application
  board</a> is now available!
</p>
<p>
  <img src="http://mbed.org/media/uploads/chris/mab-top.jpg" alt=
  "http://mbed.org/media/uploads/chris/mab-top.jpg" title=
  "http://mbed.org/media/uploads/chris/mab-top.jpg"> <img src=
  "http://mbed.org/media/uploads/chris/mab-bottom.jpg" alt=
  "http://mbed.org/media/uploads/chris/mab-bottom.jpg" title=
  "http://mbed.org/media/uploads/chris/mab-bottom.jpg">
</p>
<p>
  The first stockists to go live are (alphabetically!):
</p>
<ul>
  <li>
    <a href=
    "http://www.coolcomponents.co.uk/catalog/mbed-application-board-p-1101.html"
    rel="nofollow">Cool Components</a>
  </li>
  <li>
    <a href="http://www.rs-components.com/search.html?mpn=7694182"
    rel="nofollow">RS Online</a>
  </li>
  <li>
    <a href="https://www.sparkfun.com/products/11695" rel=
    "nofollow">Sparkfun</a>
  </li>
</ul>
<p>
  For those not yet familiar with the application board, here is a
  quote from the Sparkfun description:
</p>
<div class="flashbox fquote">
  <h4 class="ftitle">
    <span class="authortext"><a href="/users/sparkfun/"><img alt=""
    class="icon" src=
    "data:image/jpeg;base64,"></a>
    <a href="/users/sparkfun/">SparkFun Electronics</a></span>
    wrote:
  </h4>
  <p>
    This credit-card sized breakout board makes it easy to plug in
    to a whole bunch of peripherals. Simply pop an LPC1768 mbed
    module into the socket and you've got access to a 128x32
    graphic lcd, 5-way joystick, accelerometer, temperature sensor
    and more! There are headers on either side of the mbed module
    socket as well so you can jumper off to breadboards and other
    off-board components.
  </p>
</div>
<p>
  It will be great for software development and experiments, and
  running fixed labs and workshops.
</p>
<p>
  The board has a load of examples that you can use straight out
  the box, and no doubt more will be shared as the boards work
  their way out there.
</p>
<p>
  See the <a href=
  "http://mbed.org/cookbook/mbed-application-board">application
  board cookbook page</a> for more details!
</p>
